title: Grail country
name: Grail country
description:
A Map by Khae

Here go all the secret places close to RLC.

properties.name: A strange church
properties.description: Posted by KhaeWalk up from Alet (or take the car) and visit the church. It is small, and there are a few things that are, say, irregular. For example, stand where the priest would stand and look out the front window into the sky. Notice something strange?

properties.name: Chateau de Blanchefort
properties.description: Posted by Khae Some authors say that this once was a full-fledged castle. Obviously non of them took the time to climb the hill to its very top and have a good look.

properties.name: Chateau de Puilaurens
properties.description: Posted by Khae One of the many Cathar ruins in the Languedoc; this one is smaller and a bit less visited than the "big" ones. Most of the way up is shaded by trees, and it has its very own energy and feeling to it.

properties.name: Coustaussa
properties.description: Posted by Khae Pretty ruin, and pretty impossible to visit since it is in private hands. This ruin is probably best viewed when driving from RLC to Couiza.

properties.name: Donjon d'Arques
properties.description: Posted by KhaeOne of the very few old castles that can be reached without a climb! It\'s worth a visit, just because it is different from most other castles. It\'s more like a big tower.

properties.name: Hostellerie de l'Eveche
properties.description: Posted by Khae

properties.name: Le Bezu
properties.description: Posted by KhaeAnother of the five mountains which are said to form the natural pentacle of mountains, le Bezu is always worth a visit. There are ruins of a kind on the top, and usually one can have a great view from the top.

properties.name: Limoux - town centre
properties.description: Posted by Khae Another nice town close to RLC. Limoux also has various markets throughout the week, and the town centre usually is a good place to grab some food. Oh yes, and there are ATMs there, too.

properties.name: Mirepoix
properties.description: Posted by Khae Wonderful old town. Lots of cafes, and there is no better way to spend a lazy afternoon than in the shades of the wooden balustrades in Mirepoix.

properties.name: Montazels
properties.description: Posted by Khae

properties.name: Pizzeria ... but I forgot the name
properties.description: Posted by Khae l\'Esp.. something. I think. They have absolutely great pizzas, from a log-fired oven.

properties.name: Rennes-le-Chateau
properties.description: Posted by Khae

properties.name: Thermal Springs in RLB
properties.description: Posted by KhaeA nice place to relax in summer. Also walking in the riverbed is fun - if you are wearing shoes. There is lots of metal and stuff in the riverbed, and you wouldn\'t want to step into these things.

properties.name: Val d'Aleth
properties.description: Posted by KhaeThe best campsite EVAR, at least in this parts of the world.

properties.name: Water source
properties.description: Posted by Khae Somewhere around here there are two springs, and the most lovely water can be bottled for free. Delicious.
